value.title: Facebook Scientists Develop AI Software That Can Tell Origin Of Deepfake Images
value.excerpt: Facebook scientists have developed an artificial intelligence (AI) software that will not only help with identifying the deepfake images but will also reveal their origin.

value.title: The Efforts to Make Text-Based AI Less Racist and Terrible
value.excerpt: Language models like GPT-3 can write poetry, but they often amplify negative stereotypes. Researchers are trying different approaches to address the problem.

value.title: Can MXNet Stand Up To TensorFlow & PyTorch?
value.excerpt: Developed by the Apache Software Foundation, MXNet is a fully-featured, flexible, and scalable open-source deep learning framework. In a short time, MXNet has emerged as one of the strong contenders to industry favourite frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.

value.title: Facebook’s AI can copy the style of text in photos from a single word
value.excerpt: Facebook's TextStyleBrush is an AI system that can replicate the style of fonts and handwriting to replace arbitrary text in images.

value.title: How PyTorch Is Challenging TensorFlow Lately
value.excerpt: PyTorch gives our researchers unprecedented flexibility in designing their models and running their experiments.

value.title: Decades-old ASCII adventure Nethack may hint at the future of AI
value.excerpt: Machine learning models have already mastered Chess, Go, Atari games, and more, but in order for it to ascend to the next level, researchers at Facebook intend for AI to take on a different kind of game: the notoriously difficult and infinitely complex Nethack.

value.title: IBM releases AI model toolkit to help developers measure uncertainty
value.excerpt: IBM has released a toolkit designed to help developers measure uncertainty in an AI and machine learning model.

value.title: Study shows AI-generated fake reports even fool experts

value.title: Google says it’s committed to ethical AI research. Its ethical AI team isn’t so sure.

value.title: Tests of Clearview AI facial recognition software raises concerns in Minnesota
value.excerpt: At least 42 law enforcement agencies in Minnesota, including the Renville County Sheriff's Office, reportedly used Clearview AI facial recognition software, according to a Buzzfeed investigation.
